statement: FY 21 ended on a strong note with EBITDA margins of 12.2% and EBIT margins of 2.6%.
Tata Motors recorded its highest ever annual sales in 8 years, growing its market share to 8.2%.
Jaguar Land Rover achieved double-digit sales growth in China, contributing to strong performance.
The launch of Tata Intra, Yodha BS VI, and Ace Petrol are steps towards recovery.
The company has a strong focus on sustainability and aims to achieve net zero carbon emissions by 2039.
The Company enhanced its market share to 8.1% for the year ended March 31, 2021, compared to 4.8% for the previous year.
The Company recorded its highest ever annual sales in the Passenger Vehicle business.
The Company achieved a successful transition to BSVI standards despite several headwinds.
The Company improved its Industry leading score in customer satisfaction metrics significantly.
The Company has ongoing significant profitability.
The Board believes that linking employee performance with other initiatives will assist in improving the financials of the Company.
FY 21 was an extremely challenging year with severe business disruptions due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Jaguar Land Rover experienced a 14% drop in revenue to £19.7 billion.
The pandemic resulted in muted consumer demand, impacting overall sales.
The company reported a net loss of ₹13,451 crores in FY 2020-21.
The automotive industry faced significant challenges, including supply chain disruptions and rising costs.
The Company reported a loss of `13,451.39 crores for the year ended March 31, 2021.
The Company faced significant challenges due to the COVID-19 pandemic, impacting operations and financial results.
The Company recorded an exceptional charge of `14,994.30 crores under Jaguar Land Rover’s Reimagine strategy.
The Company has incurred a loss as computed under Section 198 of the Act.
No commission would be payable to the Non-Executive Directors for FY 2020-21.
By FY 24, Tata Motors aims to become the most aspirational Indian auto brand.
Jaguar Land Rover plans to launch its first all-electric model by 2024 and aims for a fully electric fleet by 2030.
The company anticipates gradual improvement in performance as the impact of the pandemic recedes.
The Company expects to contribute `100.94 crores to the funded pension plans during the year ending March 31, 2022.
The Company anticipates a smooth transition to electrification and alternate fuel options for a sustainable future.
The Company will undertake projects/establishments in and outside India.
The company faces risks related to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, which could adversely affect its business.
Deterioration in global economic conditions could impact sales and results of operations.
Intensifying competition in the automotive industry may adversely affect market share and profitability.
Supply chain disruptions, particularly in semiconductor availability, pose significant risks to production.
The Company is exposed to fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates, interest rates, equity prices, liquidity, and credit risk.
The Company faces legal proceedings and claims that may adversely affect its financial condition.
The Company has contingent liabilities amounting to `1,421.98 crores related to sales tax demands being contested.
The remuneration is linked to the performance matrices which may pose risks if not achieved.
